metadata.title: CVE-2024-35914 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nfsd:Fix error cleanup path in nfsd_rename() Commit a8b0026847b8 ("rename():avoid a deadlock in the case of parents having no common ancestor") addedan error bail out path. However this path does not drop the remountprotection that has been acquired. Fix the cleanup path to properly dropthe remount protection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35914` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
